website_summaries.verdict: The only medical penlight on our list has several features that make it great for medical or everyday use.
pros: Pupil gauge and ruler on the casing allow for quick measurements with one tool
Designed with a lower brightness for checking pupil response
Bulb is spring-loaded so if it's dropped, the bulb retreats into the penlight
cons: Can be finicky and easily turn on and off

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, unreliable and unusable after a few months...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with these penlights. One stopped working within a month with little to use (backup I keep in my office pencil container). The other still works (after 3 months) but moving it at all causes the light to dim or flicker. I've tried replacing batteries in both multiple times with no luck. I can only conclude that they're cheap junk that aren't even worth the plastic they're made of. Extremely disappointed but definitely a good lesson on cost vs. quality. Skip these penlights and go with something that will last.
customer_reviews.author: vespasian

customer_reviews.title: Yay pupils!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a medic and definitely appreciate having a pen light finally because I check everyone’s pupils now which has been SUPER helpful. I’ve given narcan like 3 times now in situations I might not have because I didn’t carry the neccarry tools to assess constricted pupils. Pupils tell you a lot and this is an item I now see as important as a stethoscope in my assessments. Only probably is that I keep these in my pocket pants the light is always turning on without me knowing so I’m worried the battery is going to go out soon. But I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jackye

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, great price and fun colors
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter who is a nurse. And although I did use them once as a flashlight to see junk under my couch AND had a blast playing with them alittle by checking my family's, pets and friends pupils...my daughter, who uses them and knows was she is doing, said these are great. She was impressed by the quality and that they have the guide right on the pens. And the colors are fun. So whether you want these as small purse/pocket flashlights or to do surprise checks for fun or do real pupil checks in the medical field, I highly recommend these. Hope this was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: M. CLEVELAND

customer_reviews.title: Bright & effective! Great cost
customer_reviews.text: One did not work, but it was an easy fix so I did not contact the seller. Great for the money. I tried these on myself to see if they would be “too bright” as advertised by some reviews I was in a poorly lit room and did not find any discomfort from having my eyes dialated by them I would agree that they may be too bright for children However in the bright setting of a hospital or Dr office, I doubt it would be uncomfortable to bear for a few moments
customer_reviews.author: Mel Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy penlight that outshines the competition
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy penlight that outshines the competition. Being able to click the light on/off is super convenient so that you can hold the penlight anyway you want and not have to fumble around with the clip. Photo shows the difference in the brightness of the light.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not just for nurses
customer_reviews.text: I'm a physician and I felt that whipping out my phone was unprofessional if I needed a light so I keep this with me on rounds. Works great and I'm very happy that I can replace the batteries so I'm not constantly throwing away pen lights.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: These are actually better quality than I expected. I'm a medic and have used ("lost") many over the years. This two pack was perfect as I needed one to carry and one to keep in my vest. Bright and feels sturdy. It clicks off and on via a button on top, button switch has nice response. With some prior penlights, I was bad about having one turn on without knowing it, but haven't ran into that issue yet. Will definitely buy again when its time (read: lose these ones)
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy light
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy light, doesn't turn on randomly in my pocket and the click top does take enough force that I'm not worried about it turning on when left in my bag. It is a bit bright for pediatric patients so when using it on younger children I recommend holding it further back then when checking an adult or the elderly. Other than that works well and no rubbing of the gages on the side yet.
customer_reviews.author: Seriously LacqueingTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Best nursing pen light I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Great little pen light. I have had this light about 6 months and so far this does not turn on accidentally in my scrubs pocket like other lights have. It also is made of a sturdy metal so I'm not afraid it is going to break with my daily use. The light is bright and works perfectly for checking patients pupils or just adding a little extra light in a dark room when trying to do an assessment in the dark. I am recommending this to all my fellow nurse friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best pen light I own!!
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy penlight. *review edited* I wrote my original review with 5 stars because it was a great pen light. I have now owned this thing for about 6-8 months and it’s still kickin ass!! It even survived a trip in the washing machine (because I’m horrible at remembering to empty my pockets) I will continue to buy this brand forever
customer_reviews.author: Ashley n. Hay

customer_reviews.title: Zero stars
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I ordered the pen light. In the photos it has two pen lights with batteries. I received ONE pen light, with no batteries. I even would have been okay if I had gotten two lights and no batteries, but I needed two. So I send the pen light back so I can get the 2 that I need. I ORDER THE SAME PRODUCT AND THEY SEND ME........ A TONGUE SCRAPER...... BEST PART..... THE CASE WAS EMPTY..... now I have zero pen lights..... And zero tounge scrapers (?).... But I have an empty tounge scraper case! Just what I needed!!!! >_<
customer_reviews.author: B. goodman

customer_reviews.title: I love these pens!!
customer_reviews.text: Great pen!! I'm an ICU nurse any use pen lights frequently, this is a great size, great light strength and durable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Came with the batteries! :)
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice pen lights. Came with 4 triple A batteries so I was all set for clinicals. One is pink and the other is white. Shines brightly.
customer_reviews.author: Online shopping lover

customer_reviews.title: ... activated from the top as opposed to the clip like most penlights
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I wanted a penlight that had to be activated from the top as opposed to the clip like most penlights. I didn't realize this came with 2 either. The light quality is really great too.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Beebe

customer_reviews.title: Batteries leaked acid and ruined the light.
customer_reviews.text: These pens are just over 3 months old and the batteries have leaked causing acid to corrode the insides. I discovered it when the light didn’t seem as bright so I changed out batteries. All seemed fine, but I noticed the batteries felt a little moist. A few seconds later, my hand was burning from battery acid. I looked inside the light and the tube and near the light connector are all corroded from leaking battery acid.
customer_reviews.author: JPal

customer_reviews.title: There was only 1
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is how I revived my package... I got one pink light with no batteries and no second light??
customer_reviews.author: Alaina R

customer_reviews.title: Not durable!
customer_reviews.text: The light has a nice look and feel to it, but mine started acting up within the first month of use. It doesn't always turn on or off when I want it to, and it is already dimming to the point at which I can't even discern pupillary reflexes. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela S.

customer_reviews.title: Too bright, not durable
customer_reviews.text: This LED is painfully bright. Too bright in my opinion for its intended use. It is also not durable and has started to flicker after only a few weeks use. I am an optometrist and purchased this item while waiting for a replacement bulb for my professional grade instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Sherah Eavey

customer_reviews.title: Its more like a regular flash light if that makes any sense
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is a little cheap and the light its a little too bright. Its more like a regular flash light if that makes any sense. Most of my patients complain about this light compared to others I've owned
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Nice to get two but would prefer one that really ...
customer_reviews.text: I want to return it. Nice to get two but would prefer one that really works well. It feels like it is falling apart when in my pocket. It also isn't bright enough. Huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Janie Daily

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These pen lights are fantastic. They came quickly and arrived wrapped together in a small package. They seem sturdy and well made. I have been using the same pen daily for 2 weeks with no signs of wear and tear. I expect to get many more tears of use out of them. They come with batteries included, which is a plus. I am 100% happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: They don't work. I have brand new batteries in them and when I go and use them the light goes in and out. When assessing my patients I need reliable equipment and this isn't it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: DreaChavez

customer_reviews.title: Very gift Worthy with a handsome presentation inside the package.
customer_reviews.text: This product is beautifully packaged. I wish I had taken a photograph to share of the contents of the box. There's a pink and a white pen light, with the little bundle of 2 batteries for each. The outer box is attractive and the inner cushioning for the product is very handsome. It is a cut out foam form that fits into the box snugly. It makes a very attractive presentation because the foam is black and the two pen lights really stand out. The little battery packets are in their own opening in the foam at either end. It is very very gift worthy, and nicely presented for the recipient.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Malone-Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Good thing it was a two-pack
customer_reviews.text: If I could I'd give 2.5 stars. Five stars would be for the pen light that works. Zero stars would be for the one that broke after clicking it on and off twice (the spring jammed). I needed to use the light(s) right away and didn't have time to send for a replacement. ADDENDUM-- Shortly after posting my original review I was contacted by Opoway customer service. They stand by their products and sent me replacement lights. Both work perfectly out of the box. 5 stars for great customer service, and replacing the faulty light.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great produce  & price
customer_reviews.text: I love these pen lights. It was nice they included batteries for both pen lights. They are light weight but sturdy & not flimsy. It's very easy to change out the batteries so no hassel trying to open. The top just screws off easily & drop in the batteries. The light is a clear nice LED & not that yellow tint light. This is a good product for the price. The clip on it is made well & not too thin or cheaply made so it clips on nicely & holds in place.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great pen light for the price!
customer_reviews.text: They came with batteries for each, which was a very pleasant surprise. I had a little difficulty getting them open to insert the batteries because they were a little hard to unscrew, but once I got it, they were easy to use. The light is nice and bright. I immediately took a look in my husband's throat and the pen light does a much better job than the flashlight on my phone. As other reviewers mentioned, mine did have the button rattle when you shake it, but frankly, how often are you shaking your pen light? For the price, I was quite pleased with the construction and function. They seem like they will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a Nurse, however:
customer_reviews.text: I work in the Immuno-Hematology Lab at one of the American Red Cross labs, and we have to know how to see into and clean the machines that conduct blood typing. These machines are big, but have many small, moving parts, and having a reliable light that can get into small hinges and nooks is necessary. However anything that required watch batteries had a limited shelf life; so this "pen" light worked so well that my personal one kept going "missing" (a.k.a: stolen by my shift lead) for hours at a time, so I bought one for everyone on my shift- now some of the other shifts want them. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mellissa Marcus

customer_reviews.title: They flicker!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these penlights to replace the cheapy, press-on-the-pen-clip kind provided to me at my work. The click on & off is fabulous, but, then pens only work intermittently! I've changed the batteries out several times with the same result. Sometimes they turn on, sometimes they don't. Sometimes they turn on and are very dim. Sometimes they'll turn on but are still very dim, and you'll need to tap them against your palm to "jiggle" the light to get brighter. Not super impressed that I need to "troubleshoot" these pen lights that should be pretty straightforward. Will look for a different brand to try next time!
customer_reviews.author: illy*23

customer_reviews.title: Now totally useless. The disposable ones work longer
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pack of two. One was used only a couple of times and it the led failed. Now totally useless. The disposable ones work longer. Edit: originally gave 2 stars. Lowered to 1 star after customer support didn't respond. I wont waste any more time with this. Healthcare workers are busy people.
customer_reviews.author: Ditters

customer_reviews.title: Works but is rather dim. Decent housing.
customer_reviews.text: Works but is rather dim compared to the pen lights we were given in class by our instructor. Bought it for my EMT class where we had to take vitals on 50 people over the course of a few classes. Could not get a pupilary response on about 1/3 of my subjects. Tried my own batteries rather than the generic ones it ships with and did not change the brightness at all so I'm assuming it is the LED they are using rather than the batteries. The housing is nice and sturdy however so I might just take out my soldering iron and replace it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, bright, the warm light is great for contact lenses
customer_reviews.text: I got this because it came with warm and white led lights. You can easily swap them on both of them. I got this to replace the junk penlight that my doctor gave to me with my contact lens package. This one is much better and many times brighter. The warm bulb is better than the white bulb for the eyes. I can now easily examine with a mirror my eyes and the contact lenses. I tried it on my skin too, and it works great. Can not even compare to not using it. There is no center hotspot, the light is even and smooth. A good deal for a package of 2.
customer_reviews.author: WayneBTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: These are way to bright! Too bright to use on a patient's eyes.
customer_reviews.author: missy3212

customer_reviews.title: Check batteries or reverse batteries if stored as a backup.
customer_reviews.text: Batteries came with the 2 lights. Just need to remember to check the batteries from time to time if one of them is a backup. If you let the batteries get so bad they leak there is no way to get them out, so I had to discard my backup one. It may have inadvertently been turned on in storage. Now backups have one battery put in backward. The reversed battery means the light can't be turned on - accidentally or on purpose. To use the backup, reversed battery has to be changed. Simple way to protect the light. Just remember to check the batteries just in case a battery has long term storage issues.
customer_reviews.author: Reality Check

customer_reviews.title: LED is too bright
customer_reviews.text: This pen light works well, comes with batteries, and is easy to set up and use. I prefer the click-to-use feature because it makes use easier and makes it less likely that the light will shine in your pocket and waste battery. Having used this brand of batteries before, I can say that they seem to have a shorter life than name brand batteries. My four star rating is due to the LED light. The light on these is VERY bright and quite uncomfortable for many people (myself included). Additionally, it doesn't work any quicker or more efficiently than a standard pen light, so I personally feel that the LED simply causes unnecessary discomfort for many patients.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Bright, blue/white light( not yellow ). Don't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of pen light. I really do. They're bright, focused, and the measurements are useful for surprise skincidents and obviously neuro checks. My only issue is that I've gone through four since I started my job in June, one just up and stopped working. No clear issue and new batteries attempted. The second two both stopped working and when I checked the batteries, battery acid was crusted over the batteries so who knows if I'm just rough with them or there's something wrong with it. I'm still going to buy them, I'm on my fourth and I go through about one a month. So it's not the worst expense..
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for nursing school and they are perfect! I love the ease of just popping the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for nursing school and they are perfect! I love the ease of just popping the the batteries and using it at the push of a button. It is really nice and heavy which seems it won't get broken easily. I will definitely be seeing these close since people love to walk away with pens lol
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Lomax

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet effective
customer_reviews.text: These are great pen lights in the field. Good for spotting things out in the dark. I no longer have to bring my flashlight with me on calls. The light is to bright however for the eyes there are other pen lights with interchangeable bulbs for yellow on the eyes and for bright white on scene. The battery life depends on the batteries you put it but I've had Duracell batteries in it for a month now and I consistently use the light all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: Although I have yet to use it for my Nursing class, the gauge on the side and just how bright the light is will certainly prove useful. I love how it also has a clip so I can attach it to the loops on my scrub pants and it stays there securely. This also came with batteries (which was such a pleasant plus). A great price, bright light, gauges on the side, 2 for 1, and included batteries...I recommended this to other Nursing friends due to how much of a steal this seemed to be haha.
customer_reviews.author: Iyanu

customer_reviews.title: Good response to quality issues
customer_reviews.text: 9/14/17 Update: Seller contacted me about my initial poor review. So far I have tried one of the 2 new lights they sent, and it has worked extremely well over the course of the week. The second light in my initial pack work fine as well. Excellent response to this issue, and I received the item within a few days, which is above what I would expect at this price, but certainly welcome. I will see how long these last and update accordingly. Color and brightness seem good. Very inexpensive. Light materials. Light is very unreliable, started flickering or not turning on after first shift using it, was never dropped or damaged in any way.
customer_reviews.author: D. Goodberry

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: These penlights are advertised as being bright but unobtrusive to the eye. I tested this out on family and they complained about how obnoxious the light was to their eyes. Update: The company contacted me about my negative experience, and happily sent me replacement warm light penlights. These were much gentler to the eye. This company has great customer service, and wants to see their customers satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Christina M. Ghaly

customer_reviews.title: Inverted spring tension on On button causes frequent accidental-on w/o being aware.
customer_reviews.text: This would be a decent light, as it's super bright, if it weren't for the inverted spring tension on the On switch. Since this kind of light ends up in a pen sleeve of most EMT pants, you can't tell when it's on ... and because the spring tension / off position depression it makes it easier to turn ON than OFF, and it constantly gets turned on during normal movement and kills the battery. Not awesome to pull out your pen light for a patient and have it not work - I do not recommend for field duty.
customer_reviews.author: Switch

customer_reviews.title: Helps me get my job done at an eye clinic!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Ophthalmic assistant, so I check pupil constriction ALL day. These pen lights are lightyears ahead of what they provide at work. They are sturdier, brighter, and grasp my scrub pockets better. The brightness is great because there is a dim halo around the bright central light, which lets me check pupil constriction easily without actually having to shine the light directly in their pupil (I can get the bright part midway through the iris and see the reflex start in the dim halo). 10/10. If these ever break, I will buy a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price but with some defects
customer_reviews.text: For $8 these are great. I get compliments in school about them because they are cute. My only problem is every now and again the lights dim/flicker. I'm not sure if this is a battery was cheap and is dying after a few uses or if it is a poor design that doesn't work well. Only time will tell. For the minimal times I need it in school (PERRLA or checking throat) I am not concerned. If you are looking for something super reliable to use all day long, I would probably recommend not going with this product just because I don't know how long they will be operable.
customer_reviews.author: Ole Miss Rebel 8811

customer_reviews.title: Too bright.  Batteries corroded
customer_reviews.text: These were actually too bright. I work in sports medicine so I do a lot of concussion checks on the sidelines on Friday nights. I was teaching students and had them shine the light in my eyes and it was way too bright. They lasted about 1.5 years. I tried to change the batteries, but they were all corroded. I bought another brand to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Bright and love the colors
customer_reviews.text: I had a pen light and only had it less then a year and it was one I could not change the batteries in so pretty much just got to throw it away, but this pen light was a set and came with both sets of batteries for each light. It is bright but not to bright to be able to check pupils. The colors are great too! I’m in nursing school and only get to have certain things that don’t have to match my fellow classmates and this I one of those item. It also helps me know it’s mine.
customer_reviews.author: Lena Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great penlight! Two to a package! Batteries included!
customer_reviews.text: Easy penlight to use--feels good in the hand. I used it as soon as I got it: looking at the dogs paw & searching for a dropped pencil under the desk. When I was a practicing nurse (now retired), I used it daily for my patient's care. So it's very handy. Love that this came two to a package!! Although I thought the measuring lines on the side were unnecessary, I've used it as a ruler in a pinch. Strong light, but not blinding light. Focused beam. Batteries included. What's not to like?!!
customer_reviews.author: LTinPDX

customer_reviews.title: Solid, lightweight, and bright
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set of 2 pen lights because both my husband and I are nurses. We had a double set of metal penlights before from another company that wore out quickly and the lights would not stay on after normal wear and tear. We just got these lights last week and have already used them and they work great. The light is bright and steady, and the body is lightweight but still feels solid and durable. We really like that there is a ruler and the pupil gauge printed on the body of the light as well. Great little lights for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Seems decent
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 1 kit with 2 lights in it... They seemed decently bright and durable. The only problem I have is that both had batteries and on one, the button seemed set lower then the other one.... kind of odd. They both still function fine, but it causes me to hesitate on quality because they obviously all aren't made to the same specs. Battery life I'm just not sure, because I haven't used them for a long time, to actually see how it is.
customer_reviews.author: JMcGarvey

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use due to faulty blue/LED light
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this pen light started falling apart, flickering, not coming on within the first couple weeks of use. I just tossed it in the garbage after seeing that the click top has fallen off. Additionally, I find it very difficult to use in clinic as the light bulb is that bright, LED blue. It makes it much harder to judge pupillary light reflex and sclera/mucosa. The video I’ve taken shows how unreliable it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy...
customer_reviews.text: I would not suggest these. If you are using these as a nurse on your patient it is preferable to use a warm light. This is excessively bright and a cold light, it is inappropriate for use in assessing a patient. The battery it came with did not last whatsoever (but that’s to be expected since it was some cheap battery). I would suggest this for a handyman or mechanic who uses a small light for repairs and such as it is convenient to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Good pen light
customer_reviews.text: The light generated is very bright and a little harsh, as you would expect from an LED light. You turn on the light by clicking the button on top. The switch has a nice, tactile feel and is preferred over the style where you keep pressure on the clip to keep the light on. The pen body is very solid and has a nice weight to it when the battery is in. I can't speak to battery life as I have not had it long enough, but the the batteries supplied are generics I never hear of. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: sun_shines

customer_reviews.title: Poor batteries
customer_reviews.text: I like the colors offered in this pen light. What I don’t like is the batteries that comes with it. Seems they worked great for my first shift but since then the light has gotten dimmer. Hopefully after changing the batteries it will work just as good as the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Make sure nothing bumps it in your bag
customer_reviews.text: I’m a nursing student and I had one of the pens in my bookbag and I guess something must have hit the top of the pen to turn it on so my pen light ended up dying. But, it came with extra batteries so it was okay. Just makes sure nothing it going to end up bumping into it and turn it on. But the pen itself works great and is VERY bright and does it job.
customer_reviews.author: elizbagl

customer_reviews.title: I like the color
customer_reviews.text: I like the color, the metal finish, how bright the lights are, the fact that they come with batteries. I also like the pupil measure and the centimeter ruler. All fantastic points. However, the contact connection between the button on top and the battery isn't the best, and sometime the light becomes dim or does even switch on, then I have to shake the penlight for it to make better contact then it starts to work again. This can be very frustrating. However, overall, for the price, good and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K2436203

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 1.5 months ago. First penlight broke when dropped once while falling out of my pocket while sitting and would not work. Second pen light is constantly on and only way to turn off light is to slightly disconnect the battery. Would like a refund or replacement. So I'm updating my review since the company reached out to me and offered a replacement. I've been using them a little under 2 weeks now and they work great with no issues. Let's hope they continue to work for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Stronger light than the disposable ones - Measurements on the side - Reusable Cons: - The on/off button at the top is very loud when clicked. It's also loosely fitted so unless you hold your thumb on it, it'll rattle when handled. - Having the button situated at the top is a bit less convenient than if it were on the clip
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Batteries leaked into pen
customer_reviews.text: I'm a nurse and rely on my pen light. This set is very nice looking. Like that it has a pupil chart on it. However, the batteries in the white one became stuck and leaked battery fluid all through it so obviously it had to be thrown away. The batteries were the correct size and installed correctly as it worked prior.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua hagadone

customer_reviews.title: Intensely bright
customer_reviews.text: These are INSANELY bright. I’m in nursing school and a bunch of us got these. I just never got around to returning them and will use them for other things probably. Almost too bright to use on a patient. Also, mine is strobe like and alters its brightness 100% of the time like flickering. I’ve tried tightening things/cleaning connections and it didn’t help at all. Would likely not get again. The simple push down To contact pen lights seem to work better.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Not good for checking pupils
customer_reviews.text: Not a medically approved light. Not ok to check pupils with it due to it being an LED.
customer_reviews.author: Thad

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and heavy. I’m at vet tech who does anesthesia for endoscopy procedures. The room is usually dark, so these have come in handy for needing light for monitoring my patient. Let’s me see what I need, but doesn’t bother the doctor and what she’s doing. I’ve replaced the batteries once.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Best out of 3 brands I tried
customer_reviews.text: The clip/ability to attach to the side of scrub pocket is a life saver. The pupil eye chart also v helpful. Only complaint is it’s a tad brighter than I would like/ Slightly uncomfortable for patients, but after buying 3 different brands, these were a clear winner and the one I’m still using daily.
customer_reviews.author: soccerstar666

customer_reviews.title: Too bright for patient assessments
customer_reviews.text: The penlight seems to be a great value and is pretty well made. However, these lights are way to strong to shine in any patient's eyes. You will do more harm than good. I wouldn't recommend this light for any eye examination. If the light was softer this would be a great purchase. I currently use this penlight to examine the mouth and ears. I will not purchase this light again unless they have a version with softer white light. The softer version they do sell emits a yellow light that is optimal brightness for pupil response but is too yellow and as others have said make a patient appear jaundiced.
customer_reviews.author: Zahrod

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: These pens are a great buy! They're inexpensive but they feel nicely made and durable. I didn't realize when I bought them that each pen comes with a different head for the change in lighting. I thought it was just a double click to change the color tone. However, it still works out. I use the white one for my bright white light and the pink for the warm tone light. Can't complain! Happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Jayliz Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Firm click button, bright light
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It's a great quality pen light. The light is really bright, and is white, as described. The button on the top is pretty firm, so it's not as easy to press it accidentally. It clips firmly to a pocket, so you can put it there during the day. My and SO and I are both medical professionals and are really liking this so far. It also comes with batteries for both pen lights, so it's really convenient.
customer_reviews.author: cstar

customer_reviews.title: Handy, Light Weight and Fits Small Spaces
customer_reviews.text: Use these as a general household tool. To spot check the furnace and home temp at night (conveniently stored on top of the thermostat) to check that doors are locked, make bathroom visits, etc, without turning on lights. I also tucked one in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: J. O.

customer_reviews.title: Great for light therapy!
customer_reviews.text: I recently read that holding light between your eyebrows for 15-30 minutes a day will greatly help seasonal depressive disorder, depression and increase your mood and energy. I ordered these to find out and I’m happy to note that it’s definitely made a difference. It noticeably increased my energy and helped me to feel more mentally awake and calmer!
customer_reviews.author: Bekah S.

customer_reviews.title: Multi-use tool for me
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to be able to use in small places. I use it to look into my garbage disposal and into my kids' ears. Perfect light for that! So far, the parts have held up great, in spite of my kids getting a hold of it. Hubby got the white one to use at his job at the hospital. I guess it's doing great because I haven't heard any complaints. Would order again!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: They're exactly as described and they all loved them. I'm extremely happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 packs of these (6 in total) to give to my classmates as a gift. I have one myself and it's lasted an extremely long time, despite my toddler playing with it. They're exactly as described and they all loved them. I'm extremely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KathG

customer_reviews.title: Good light for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several different pen light brands. These have been the best for the money. I seem to have a habit of losing my lights. Because of that I don’t want to purchase some of the more expansive lights out there. But I don’t want to just buy cheap ones that don’t work well either. These have been a good middle ground. I haven’t had any issues with the lights breaking or not working, just losing them. The pupil gauges have not worn off, which was an issue with cheaper models.
customer_reviews.author: ward

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use on pets
customer_reviews.text: I just got these today so the battery life is unknown. They do seem to not be very durable but I will advise further. I got these strictly for my dogs ears and they work great for that so hopefully they will last since I'm not an in-the-field EMT or nurse actually having to use them a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Black Widow

customer_reviews.title: Don't use Batteries that come with Penlight
customer_reviews.text: Don't use the batteries that come with them. The battery inside expanded and spilled chemicals inside the light. Now I have to throw the penlight away because no way am I going to put this over a patient's eyes and risk getting chemicals in patients eyes. I threw away all the other batteries from my other pen lights as a have 4 of these. The battery is so cheap that it doesn't even say what is in the battery other than there is 0% Mercury Cadmium. The battery is called Super Lusty?!?!?! Picture quality isn't very good. Battery and sitting in a trash bag on the floor so was difficulty keeping focus. But you get the idea.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful addition
customer_reviews.text: I have granddaughter who likes to dress up and pretend. This is part of a doctor kit I am putting together for Christmas. I know she will be very happy. She was in the hospital recently, so she is aware of how each thing is used. Maybe we should pray for the family dog. I have a feeling she will be a patient.
customer_reviews.author: red

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !
customer_reviews.text: Works as describe and projects a clean white light. Needed for neuro checks. Pen has a button instead of pushing the clip to turn on so you won't have to worry about the light being turned on by accident. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: They work, but...
customer_reviews.text: The button to turn them on has too little give, and often find I accidentally turn the pen light on. They drained a pair of batteries already because the pen light was on for too long. Also I wish the light was slightly brighter. They’re good for checking pupils but wish I could use them to check throats as well. They are however cheap and work, I think these would suffice for some people. You also get a pair of them so that’s a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I use these as a nurse practitioner...and, I buy them regularly for my students (as adjunct nursing faculty). They work beautifully, and I have not had any problems with them. I only wish that I got a discount...since I buy so many! Previously I have bought them in packs with both white...and in packs with white and pink.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Love my penlights !
customer_reviews.text: I love my penlights. The light is perfect aswell as the color of the pen. They also come with batteries which is great that way you can use them right away !
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: It rests nicely in my pocket and when I need to use ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a medical student and recently started my rotations in hospitals so I needed a penlight. I have not had any issues with it turning on in my pocket. It rests nicely in my pocket and when I need to use it the light is nice and bright. I am glad I went with this product and hoping the penlight will continue to work well and last for a while. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The light works well.
customer_reviews.text: I need a penlight mostly for neuro checks. The light works well but the reason that I took a star off is that the light has caused a few complaints from my clients in that it is too bright. Yes, I know that this might be picky but the clients are a tad older and not used to the led lights. Other than that, I myself, have no problem with the light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy, not too bright
customer_reviews.text: I work as a nurse on nights. This pen is not too bright (for having to shine in people's eyes at 8 at night or later). The construction is solid. It does get turned on in my pocket sometimes pretty easily but then I just become a walking nightlight so no bworries g deal. 😊
customer_reviews.author: AthenaShay

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made and very poor quality control. Sometimes the bulb connection with battery is loose which causes light to be dimmed or does not turn on at all. Don't waste your money on this crap.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Comes with batteries
customer_reviews.text: The brightness is very good. I only put 5 stars on battery life and durability because I haven’t been able to use them all that much yet. They do come with batteries so that’s a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Nice lights until they leaked acid and were ruined in less than 1 year
customer_reviews.text: These penlights worked nice until one day I went to use them and they were both dead. Checked both penlights, and the batteries had leaked so severely, I could not remove the AAA cells to clean the penlights and replace with new AAA cells. Even tried driving the open lights against a 2x4 to dislodge the leaking cells, but they would not budge. Very disappointing to have both of these lights last less than 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: spaz

customer_reviews.title: Great brightness, Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: As a night nurse, these come in very handy. Yes you can do neuro checks & check pupils, but they are handy for checking a squawking IV pump without turning on the light, or if you just need to do a quick check on a patient and don't want to wake them or their roommate up.
customer_reviews.author: L.C. Maven Valum

customer_reviews.title: alright for the price
customer_reviews.text: its been working great accept the cap over the button to turn it on falls off all the time. just pop it back on and it works fine. I keep it in my work bag and often find its been on the whole time its been in my bag. I guess i accidentally bump it and turn it on even when I keep it in a smaller pouch just with other pens and things like that. I guess the battery use is really good though because i've had it for a bit and it hasn't died on me yet!
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I would give them zero stars if I could. I did not even receive the right item. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Eye see you!
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. Bought this two pack as my husband & I are both healthcare professionals. This set is great for the price & included batteries. So far so good. We haven’t had long enough to comment on try durability.
customer_reviews.author: WileE2900

customer_reviews.title: Great Pen Lights!
customer_reviews.text: I really love these penlights. They do the job well and they work great. The only thing I don't like about them is I accidentally click the light on without meaning too. It kills the batteries fast. I wish it was harder to click the button so that I wasn't accidentally pressing it so much. Otherwise I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well & not in the medical field!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband to use at work. He is in construction, so having a light in dark areas “spotlight”, plus the added bonus of small measurement on the side, is awesome. The cost of these for two lights is excellent! This has had daily use, many times a day, with no issues. Great find!
customer_reviews.author: Keri N.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for nurses
customer_reviews.text: These pen lights are really nicely made. They have a nice weight to them so they don’t feel like they are going to break. They are easy to turn on and off, and the pupil measurements are really nice. The light in them is very bright too.
customer_reviews.author: c.costa

customer_reviews.title: Works every other time
customer_reviews.text: The light works well (when it works) but for some reason, the light only turns on sometimes and you have to fiddle with it. I work nights on a pediatric unit so I don't have time to fiddle with a sometimes working penlight on a sleeping child. I've tried changing the battery, nothing seems to keep the light consistently turning on.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Buttons easily engaged.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not quite happy with this pen because of the way they made the button. It A) wiggles and makes a rattling sound B) turns on very easily, with a bump or knocking against the side of something. They are very bright though. Not sure if it is too bright yet. I'm currently looking at purchasing another from a different maker.
customer_reviews.author: Logan 😎

customer_reviews.title: Nice value
customer_reviews.text: Nice light for the price, but I dropped it once and the clicker button broke off
customer_reviews.author: Kate Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and one broke and the other one stopped working even with new batteries. Didn’t even have them for a month. He is an emt
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: This one will last!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but this is no ordinary “sort price low-to-high” product. I’ve gone through a few penlights over the years. When this one arrived, I was blown away... it’s so heavy duty and durable! The light on it is perfect, not cheap flashlight-dim but not obnoxiously bright either. I feel like the pupil gauge and ruler won’t wear off like on previous lights I’ve owned. It came in a 2-pack but honestly it’ll probably be a decade before I’ll need the other one with how well-made this is.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Peplinski

customer_reviews.title: 2 lights were replaced, a total of 4 lights stopped working
customer_reviews.text: 2 lights were replaced, a total of 4 lights stopped working. Very poor quality, they do not make good contact with the batteries and they flicker like crazy, half the time not lighting up. Or they just plain old don't work for some other reason. I would not buy again. Bad purchase, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan DeSalvo

customer_reviews.title: Comes apart easily!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not made to last. Disappointing. They'd be great if they didn't continually fall apart. I've purchased this product THREE times. The third time was NOT the charm. They aren't put together very well as the clicker feature pops off and the light mechanism gets loose and then they flicker and stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Mía

customer_reviews.title: turns on in my pocket
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend; turns on when unintended. I do like pen lights with the pupil gauges and it is nice that it has the measurements etc. Perhaps they can make the button more sturdy so it does not constantly turn on. I do not carry this one with me now due to light turning on. I bought the cheap ones again for carrying with me in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Customer buyer reviewer

customer_reviews.title: ... clip on these is way subpar (bic pens have better clips, which is really inconvenient for me since ...
customer_reviews.text: Only docking two stars because the side clip on these is way subpar (bic pens have better clips, which is really inconvenient for me since it broke the first day of use) and the on/off button is really poorly constructed. It hasn't broken yet but one drop and I can see that thing shattering and rendering it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Labriola

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pair
customer_reviews.text: I bought one from the bookstore because the one that came with my LVN bag went AWOL. It was a piece of crap and wouldn't even stay screwed together. I'm way happier with this one, and stoked two came in the package because it's easy to lose. Just in case you throw it in the wash with your scrubs, too, I think it's helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Recieved the pen lights and very pleased. Had a solid feel to them and work ...
customer_reviews.text: Recieved the pen lights and very pleased. Had a solid feel to them and work well. Love having 2 for the price as my coworkers will want to "borrow " one. A very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Morse

product_meta.title: Opoway Nurse Pen Light with Pupil Gauge LED Medical Pen Lights for Nursing Students Doctors with Batteries 2pcs White
product_meta.description:
Size:White Light| Color:White| Number of Items:2

Warm Tip: Although the penlight can be used as lighting mini flashlight, buy it is more suitable for medical! 


Specification:
Material: aluminum alloy 
LED color: White
Shell color: Ceramics White 2pcs in pack
Push-button on/off switch, easy to control.
Click and it holds, Extra bright pre-focused beam. 
A 5cm-ruler on the back of the penlight. 
The pre-focused pinpoint lens directly illuminates eyes, ears and throat. 


Package include:
2 x Opoway Penlight(Ceramics White)
4 x AAA batteries(free)


If you have any questions, please feel free to contact with us at anytime, we will try to reply to you of any consult of the product within 24 hours.
feature_bullets: Useful: Pupil gauge printed on the body of the nursing penlight for determining pupil size or dilation, or check into a patients throat, mouth or even to illuminate deep wounds to check on the status of patients healing.
Affordable and Reusable: This penlight comes with its own batteries, you could change the batteries when they die instead of just throwing your penlight away.
Functional: The White LED lighting of this penlight for stethoscope is bright and useful for looking in ears and throats to see if there is redness or other signs of infection.

Beautiful: Ceramics White and aluminum alloy appears very sleek and high end a good present choice for person who works as doctor, nurse, can be relied upon for all medical circumstances, also an awesome addition to any first aid kit or just to have in a drawer in your house for special times.

Convenience: Compare with other plastic clip, this penlight has a silver metal clip that you can clip it on your shirt or scrubs, no need to worry clip will break in your line of work, very convenience and professional, also comes with two triple AAA batteries is very durable.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
